DOC.brief_summary: - To evaluate pharmacokinetics ( PK ) omecamtiv mecarbil Japanese subject heart failure ( HF ) reduce ejection fraction ; - To evaluate safety tolerability oral omecamtiv mecarbil
DOC.brief_title: Safety , PK , Efficacy Omecamtiv Mecarbil Japanese Subjects With Heart Failure With Reduced Ejection Fraction
DOC.criteria: Japanese male female ≥ 20 year ≤ 85 year age History chronic stable HF reduce ejection fraction , define require treatment HF minimum 4 week prior screen Reated HF optimal pharmacological therapy Left ventricular ejection fraction ≤ 40 % screening . Severe uncorrected valvular heart disease Hypertrophic obstructive cardiomyopathy , active myocarditis , constrictive pericarditis , clinically significant congenital heart disease Acute myocardial infarction , unstable angina , persistent angina rest within 30 day prior randomization Systolic BP > 160 mmHg < 90 mmHg , diastolic BP > 90 mmHg , HR > 110 beat per minute ( bpm ) HR < 50 bpm Estimated glomerular filtration rate ( eGFR ) < 30 mL/min/1.73m2 TBL ≥ 2x ULN , ALT AST ≥ 3x ULN Other Exclusion Criteria may apply .
